# Harmonic Scale in C (Mode: Ultra Locrian, Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The Harmonic Scale in C, specifically in the Ultra Locrian mode with the D shape, is a unique and exotic scale that can add intrigue and tension to your music compositions. By blending elements of the Locrian mode with a raised seventh degree, this scale offers a complex and dissonant sound that can be both challenging and compelling to work with.

## Notes and Intervals
The Harmonic Scale in C, Ultra Locrian mode with the D shape, consists of the following notes and intervals:
- C (Root)
- Db (Minor 2nd)
- Eb (Minor 3rd)
- F (Perfect 4th)
- Gb (Diminished 5th)
- Ab (Minor 6th)
- B (Minor 7th)

The intervals in this scale create a dissonant and unresolved quality that can evoke a wide range of emotions and moods in your musical compositions.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This scale is often used in genres such as jazz, fusion, and experimental music due to its complex and intriguing sound. The Harmonic Scale in C, Ultra Locrian mode with the D shape, provides a sense of tension and mystery that can add depth and sophistication to your musical compositions. It is commonly used to create an edgy and avant-garde atmosphere, making it a favorite among musicians looking to push the boundaries of conventional harmony.
